knimeNode.name: PMM Joiner
knimeNode.shortDescription: Joins models and data in one table and assigns time and bacterial concentration (Log10N) to parameter names of the model formulas in preparation for a model estimation or a forecast.

fullDescription.intro: Joins models and data in one table so that every microbial data set is assigned to all models. Furthermore, the node assigns time and bacterial concentration (Log10C) to parameter names of the model formulas. Data could be time series of bacterial concentrations from laboratory experiments, needed for a primary estimation. Data could also mean specific time intervals and conditions like temperature, pH and/or water activity in preparation for a forecast.
fullDescription.option: Joins primary model parameters with time and concentration.
Joins secondary model parameters with test conditions from data used in the fitting of primary models.

Joins data with an omnibus model / to a combined formula of one primary and one or more secondary formulas. Dependent on the amount of data sets the execution of the node may take longer than two minutes.
Assign data to model parameters. For example, if a formula contains the parameter "t" you can choose from the dropdown menu that this represents "time".

ports.inPort: The upper port requires models. These may come from the Model Reader, the Formula Reader, the XLS Model Reader, the Model Creator or from the Formula Creator.

For a primary estimation the lower port requires time series of bacterial concentrations, e.g. from the ComBase Reader, the Data Reader or the XLS Data Reader. For a forecast time and temperature need to be defined which can be done with a Microbial Data Creator or a Table Creator.
ports.outPort: A combined table with models and data
